Where: Station 1 at 300 Middlefield Road Menlo Park, CA
Event Status: confirmed
Event Description: Save the date for our Pancake Breakfast and Open House Saturday October 4th from 730am - 1100am!!! Come meet your firefighters and see the Jaws of Life in action as well as our airboat, Fire Engine Old Tom, and see the inside of a working fire station!!! See you there!!! Laura & Teddy: we'll try to make it depending on how Teddy feels. Yum!

entry.title: Pot luck picnic at Ange
entry.summary:
When: Thu Sep 25, 2014 10:30am to 1pm  PDT

Where: 777 San Antonio Rd #25 Palo Alto
Event Status: confirmed
entry.content:
When: Thu Sep 25, 2014 10:30am to 1pm  PDT

Where: 777 San Antonio Rd #25 Palo Alto
Event Status: confirmed
Event Description: A nice and relaxing way to celebrate the beginning of Fall. Please bring a plate or refreshments to share. **we moved the potluck to Ange's place: 777 San Antonio Rd #25 Palo Alto please try to park only in the visitor lot Nerene & Avery - we'll bring vegetables and dips and some Australian biscuits (cookies), napkins and plates. Ange/Martin- we will bring cutlery and cups and sliced melon Caitlin and Leif- we will bring grapes, some sort of small crackers and juice boxes Cheryl - we'll plan to stop by quickly from 10:30-11. And bring pretzels Laura- we're a maybe. Lisa - We're in! I am making a quinoa salad. Corinne + Sarah - change of plans, we have to pass. Sarah has school til noon and the JBF presale starts at 2pm. I hope we can join you next time! Have fun! Julia: we had a rough morning and so I'm not sure we'll make it. Hope to see you soon, rested and in better spirits! Erin - we're going to stay away and try not to spread the cold. Have a great picnic!

entry.title: Crafting for kids
entry.summary:
When: Tue Sep 23, 2014 10am to 11am  PDT
Replaces event originally scheduled for: Tue Sep 23, 2014 10am

Where: 540 Bryant St. Palo Alto, CA 94301
Event Status: confirmed
entry.content:
When: Tue Sep 23, 2014 10am to 11am  PDT
Replaces event originally scheduled for: Tue Sep 23, 2014 10am

Where: 540 Bryant St. Palo Alto, CA 94301
Event Status: confirmed
Event Description: Julia&Ada-we liked it so we'll try it again this week. They have different projects and it's a fun place to get messy:) RSVP required recurs Every Tue until 10/2/2014 under PAMP Where: C is for Craft 540 Bryant St. Palo Alto, CA 94301 Group:PAMP Parents Club PAMP Parents Club Description: The one hour class will be conducted by one of our staff and the kids will be able to paint, color, cut and paste a few exciting projects that are age ability appropriate. The main ingredients in everything we do is encouraging creativity and having FUN!!! C is for Craft, LLC is a craft studio with a focus on the preschool community—teaching and interacting with preschoolers and their caregivers. C is for Craft is a place where parents and caregivers can go with their preschool-aged children—20 months to 8 years old—and participate in creating old-fashioned, handcrafted projects. NO REFUNDS! Walk-ins are NOT welcome as this is a subsidized PAMP event open to PAMP Members Only. Oh no! Is the RSVP list full but you are still interested in attending? Please email kidsevents@PAMPCLUB.ORG and request to be put on the waitlist! Please include your phone number. Want to attend an event for free? Sign up to be a PAMP volunteer! Email volunteer@pampclub.org for more info. Get more info on PAMP Events: PAMP Calendar http://pampclub.org/site/calendar PAMP Facebook Page www.facebook.com/pampclub

entry.title: Train Days at Los Altos History Museum
entry.summary:
When: Sun Sep 21, 2014 10am to 4pm  PDT

Where: 51 S San Antonio Rd, Los Altos, CA 94022
Event Status: confirmed
entry.content:
When: Sun Sep 21, 2014 10am to 4pm  PDT

Where: 51 S San Antonio Rd, Los Altos, CA 94022
Event Status: confirmed
Event Description: $5/ person. Under 4 free Los Altos, CA – Community favorite, Train Days, returns to the Los Altos History Museum for two days of train-filled fun celebrating the joy and wonder of model railroading. Elaborate layouts, intricate scenery and scaled renditions of prototypes and whimsical engines and theme cars, complete with steam, lights and sound, will speed along rails to delight visitors of all ages. Explore the gauges and scales associated with model railroading as private collectors and clubs as they showcase and answer questions about their American, European and Asian layouts:  Live Steamers from the Bay Area Garden Railway Society (G scale)  Diablo Pacific Short Line (G scale)  Golden Gate Lionel Railroad Club (O scale)  Private Collector: Swiss Narrow Gauge (HO scale)  Peninsula NTrak and AsiaNrail (N scale)  Private Collector: the Civil War's First Battle of Manassas / Bull Run (N scale) Also on board will be California Operation Lifesaver, providing education on proper rail safety. And gourmet food trucks will be onsite selling delectables to satiate Train Days patrons.
